title: Fatalities - U.S. train crashes 2005 to 2018
summary: U.S. travel fatalities have been recorded in each of the last 12 years , with a total of 878 deaths in 2018 due to U.S. crashes .

However , despite some pronounced year-to-year differences , the overall trend has been for a reduction in the Number of fatalities – a trend confirmed when looking at a slightly longer or much longer time frame .

Fatal airline accidents According to the Convention on International Civil Aviation , U.S. train fatalities refer to an incident where a person is fatally injured due to an occurrence associated with the operation of the aircraft .
